title: Journal Pre-proof Atypical lung feature on chest CT in a lung adenocarcinoma cancer patient infected with COVID-19 Letters Atypical lung feature on chest CT in a lung adenocarcinoma cancer patient infected with COVID-19
body:
Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19)(1,2) is currently a major medical issue, and several studies have reported the typical lung features of the disease on chest CT. We present manifestations of COVID-19 in a patient with lung adenocarcinoma.

In February 2020, a 46-year-old female patient presented with a growing palpable mass on the right parietal region with no any other symptoms or history. She initially visited the Second Hospital of Luohe City on February 4, 2020, and was examined by one physician who was diagnosed with COVID-10 on (Table 1) . Her symptoms started to improve, and she was transferred to a general ward.

Chest CT images showed diffuse irregular small diffuse ground-glass nodular opacities with partial consolidation in bilateral lungs on Day 10 ( Figure 1A 

This study was approved by the local institutional review board, and written informed consent was obtained from the patient.
